intro: Lobelia anceps f. ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda lobelia, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in montane regions. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
